physical_description: Extent: ii, 154, ii leaves : paper ; 213 x 157 (135 x 92) mm. bound to 215 x 170 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from rubric on fol. 1b.|Physical description: 15 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red for headings and entries. Wove paper. At the beginning and the end of the copy are two fly-leaves of another type of wove paper. Table of contents on fol. (ii)b. Note on fol. (i)a mentioning that the Sharḥ Ḥadīth al-Ghamāmah by the author was seen as Risālah 11 in 1391 H. Note on fol. (ii)a, mentioning that the copy of the mentioned Risālah 11 moved to a private library. First folio torn in half.|Origin: According to colophon, copied by al-Tabrīzī(?) Muḥammad, known as Muḥsin, in the middle of Ṣafar 1206 [1791] in Dār al-Ṣalṭanah Iṣfahān, on his way back from Khurasān (fol. 152b). A later date might however be considered.

physical_description: Extent: iv, 183, iii leaves : paper, illustrations ; 112 x 158 (80 x 130) mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title supplied by cataloger, from title of two first texts.|Marginal annotations by later hands (partly cut off due to the trimming of the pages). Some leaves are misplaced (see beginning of the fourth maqālah of Fuṣūl Abuqrāṭ on fol. 15a). Fol. 63 consists of two leaves pasted on one other, with inscriptions visible on the pasted side of the leaves. Pagination using Arabic numerals (starts with "3" on fol. 1). Inscriptions on the recto and verso of the first flyleaf. Inscription mentioning Aḥmad al-Ḥusaynī on fol. 116a. Spine label (horizontal, partly wanting) with title, the extant part reading: "ṭibb wa-al-nujūm."|Collation: Paper ; fol. 283 + ii (i.e. 183 folios: foliation jumps from 152 to 253) ; catchwords ; pagination using Hindu-Arabic numerals ; modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|Layout: 19 lines per page ; writing is parallel to spine.|Description: Written in medium small naskh in black ink ; rubricated.|Paper: Dark cream paper, soft, with laid and chain lines and pulp visible. European paper fly-leaves.|Origin: [Qānūnchah fī al-ṭibb] Copied in the middle of Ṣafar 680 (colophon, fol. 57a) -- [Treatise on astronomy] Copied by Ayyūb (or Abū?) ...? in Arzinjān [Erzincan] in the Madrasat al-...? in ...? (fol. 141b)|Impression of a small square stamp (10 mm.) throughout (see fol. 9b, 63b, 283b, etc.) Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 216 leaves : paper ; 277 x 180 (200 x 118) mm. bound to 280 x 185 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from colophon (fol. 215a).|Physical description: 27 lines per page. Written in small naskh in black ink. The text is framed within a border in gold and black with an outer frame consisting of a single red line to define the margin. The titles of the sections of the text are repeated in black ink on the margin. Inscriptions on pastedown of upper cover and on fol. 1a-2a and 215b, including verses of poetry, and quotations attributed to Ibn ʻArabī ("ṣāḥib al-Futūḥāt") and to ʻAlī ("Amīr al-Muʾminīn").|Decorations: The first two pages of the text (fol. 2b-3a) have a margin filled with an arabesque with flowers, executed in gold, red, and black. The text is written in clouds in gold outlined in black. Elaborate headpiece (ʻunwān) on fol. 3b.|Origin: According to colophon, copied by Ismaʻīl ibn Muḥammad Taqī al-Shīrāzī, and completed on Sunday 2 Rajab 1222 [Sept. 1807] for Mīrzā Aḥmad(?) (fol. 215a).

physical_description: Extent: i, 150 leaves, i : paper, ill. ; 170 x 101 (125 x 55) mm. bound to 175 x 111 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title supplied by cataloger.|The occasional marginalia are from the author. Table of contents by a later hand on fol. 1a (prev. 2a).|Collation: Paper ; fol. 151 ; some collation notes ; modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|Layout: 19 lines per page ; frame-ruled in gold, red and blue, outer frame in red.|Description: Written in a small script using black ink ; overlining and other use of red.|Decoration: Elaborate illuminated headpiece in gold, blue, white, yellow and purple (fol. 1b). From text 2, the beginning of each text is decorated by an illuminated panel with the same floral motifs (fol. 7b, 21b, 27b, 32b, 44b, 56b, 98b, 133b). Contains six miniatures, representing learned men (fol. 27a, 54b, 103a, 132b, 133a, 140b). On fol 27a : Outdoor scene representing a sitting man wearing a brown and green garnment and a white and red turban. On fol. 54b : Outdoor scene with two men facing each other, the one on the left reading a text on a roll and the one of the right pointing to the sky with the index of his right hand, and to the ground with the index of his left hand. On fol. 103a : Indoor scene with two sitting men. The one on the left, dressed in green and red, reads a book to the one one the right, dressed in yellow. On fol. 132b : A standing man dressed in blue and yellow meditating. On fol. 133a : A standing man dressed in green and purple with a cane in his right hand meditating. On fol. 140b : Indoor scene representing two men sitting and discussing on the fore ground with a book laying between them; third man in the background coming in, a leaf with text in his hand.|Origin: [Risālat al-Zawrāʼ] Copied Ṣafar 907 by Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī (fol. 26b) -- [al-Ḥāshiyah ʻalá al-Zawrāʼ] Copied Ṣafar 907 (fol. 21a) -- [al-Ḥāshiyah ʻalá khuṭbat al-Zawrāʼ] Copied Ṣafar 907 by Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī (fol. 26b) -- [Risālah fī taʻrīf] Copied by Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī (fol. 43b) -- [Sharḥ khuṭbat al-Ṭawāliʻ] Copied by Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī in 907 (fol. 56a) -- [Ḥāshiyat al-Tahdhīb] Copied by Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī in Rabīʻ al-Awwal 907 -- [Ḥawāshī ʻalá Maṭāliʻ] Copied on 28 Rabīʻ al-Thānī 907 by Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī ibn Abī Bakr.

physical_description: Extent: 237 leaves : paper ; 210 x 130 (140 x 67) mm. bound to 250 x 135 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from the beginning of the second part (fol. 80b).|The title also appears at the end of the second part (fol. 92b: "tamma fann al-nabāt min Kitāb al-Shifāʾ").|Title written in Roman characters on a page pasted on fol. 1a: "ada qtab aelm alsma oulaealm llcheh abn aali sina baad alchfa".|23 long lines per page. Written in small nastaʻlīq with elements of naskh in black ink with red overlining for headings. Some chapter headings are reproduced in the margin in red ink (stops after fol. 89a). From fol. 92b on, blank spaces have been left in the text for the headings but were never filled. Collation marks in the margins by the same hand. Catchword on the verso of each leaf. Two seals on fol. 2a. Light cream paper with fibres and horizontal chain lines visible. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|Two lines from the beginning of the text are obliterated. One can only read a collation note in the margin, reading: "al-samāʾ wa al-ʻālam". The end of the text is obliterated, as is the brief colophon (3 lines).|The title page has been pasted on fol. 1a. One can see through the paper that there are inscriptions on the original fol. 1a.|Acquired from Brill, Leyden, 1925, from the books of Murād Bey Bārūdī (Beirut).

subject_as_recorded: Abū al-Iṣbaʻ ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz ibn Tammām, 10th cent. Qaṣīdat al-ghurūr|Alchemy--Islamic countries--Early works to 1800|Islamic magic--Early works to 1800|Magic tricks--Early works to 1800|Philosophy, Arab--Early works to 1800|Talismans--Islamic countries--Early works to 1800
note: Fols. 97; 22.2-23.2 x 15.6-16.3 cm.; written surface 15.5-16.5 x 9-10.5 cm.; 15-25 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in naskhi; with catchwords; entries in red.|A collection containing:|1. [Kashf al-asrār lil-afhām], a commentary by al-Jaldakī, A.H. 762 [A.D. 1361] on Qaṣīdat al-ghurūr, an ode on philosopy and morals by Abū al-Iṣbaʻ ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz ibn Tammām al-ʻIrāqī, who flourished in the latter part of the IVth Muslim century. See Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), V, p. 202; Fihrist al-kutub al-ʻArabīyah al-maḥfūẓah bi-al-Kutubkhānah al-Khudaywīyah, V, pp. 390, 394. MS incomplete at the end. Probably from XVIIIth century.|2. A part of the Koran containing Sūrahs XXXVI; II: 256; CXII.|3. A number of prescriptions of alchemy.|4. al-Sarīyah al-naqīyah fī ʻilm al-kammīyah, an anonymous treatise on alchemy.|5. A fragmentary commentary on a work on alchemy.|6. Nūr al-ḥaqāʼiq wa-īḍāḥ al-ṭarāʼiq, a work on magic and chance by Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-ʻIrāqī al-Sīmāwī, who flourished in the VIth Muslim century. Cf. Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), IV, p. 290; Pertsch, Die orientalischen handschriften der Herzoglichen bibliothek zu Gotha, 1274; Rieu, Supplement of the catalogue of the Arabic Mss, 784. MS probably from XVIIIth century.|Marginal notes. MS in fair condition; Arabic binding.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

scribe_as_recorded: ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn Ṣafāy Chalabī, active 18th century
scribe_as_recorded_agr: عبد القادر بن صفاي چلبي، active 18th century
physical_description: Extent: 80 leaves : paper ; 318 x 215 (260 x 170) mm bound to 323 x 228 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1b).|A few marginal lines. In the colophon the work is attributed to Ibn al-Qāsim Maslamah ibn Aḥmad, known as al-Majrīṭi, 398 [1007/8]. This is obviously a mistake, since the work is of composite authorship. al-Majrīṭi, however, is associated with the introduction of the work into Spain. Long inscription labelled "Ḥāshiyah wāqiʻah ʻalá ʻibārat Qāḍī [obscured]" (fol. 1a). Description of contents (fol. 1b).|Collation: Paper ; fol. iii + 80 + iii ; modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|Layout: 21 lines per page.|Description: Watermarks ; MS in fair condition.|Origin: According to the colophon copy completed 22 Dhū al-Ḥijjah 1127 by ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn Ṣafāy Chalabī ibn Ṭāhā Afandī (fol. 80a).|Ownership signature: Mullā Aḥmad ibn Mullā Maḥmūd al-Kabīsī[?], Imām Jāmiʻ Qabr ʻAlī dated 1246 (fol. 1b). Acquired from Brill, Leyden, 1904.

subject_as_recorded: Athīr al-Dīn al-Abharī, al-Mufaḍḍal ibn ʻUmar, d. 1265. Hidāyat al-ḥikmah|Islamic philosophy--Early works to 1800|Metaphysics--Early works to 1800
note: Fols. 69; 18.2 x 13.3 cm.; written surface 13 x 6.5-8.5 cm.; 18-21 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper, in naskhi and Fārisi; with catchwords; entries in red.|A collection containing:|1. A fragment of commentary by ḥusayn ibn Muʻīn al-Dīn al-Maybudī on Hidāyat al-ḥikmah, a work on logic, physics and metaphysics by al-Abharī, A.H. 663 [A.D. 1264/5]. This fragment contains a part of the second book (ṭabīʻīyāt = physics) and commences with the chapter on the elements (ʻunṣurīyāt). See ḥājjī Khalffah VI, p. 474; Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 5065. The work was printed in Constantinople, A.H. 1263.|2. A commentary by Ṣafar Shāh on a work of metaphysics. The copy was made in A.H. 797 [A.D. 1395] by Mūsá ibn Muḥammad ibn Maḥmūd al-Burussawī, a disciple of the author. The colophon indicates that the author was still living at the time. MS rare.|Marginal and interlinear notes; MS in fair condition; Arabic binding.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

physical_description: Extent: 98 leaves: paper ; 170 x 128 (130 x 85) mm. bound to 170 x 130 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from fol. 1a.|21 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Dark cream paper with chain lines visible. Note on the text and the way it is related to Ghazzālī's Tahāfut on fol. 1a. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|The colophon and notes on the last page seem to indicate that this copy was made in 915 H. by Maḥmūd ibn Muṣṭafá, and came to the possession of Aḥmad al-MRWN in 1135 H. (see fol. 98a). However, R. Mach dates the copy 1135 H. [1722 or 3].|Collation: Paper, fol. 98 ; 1-910 108 ; catchwrod on the verso of each leaf.|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: i, 18, i leaves: paper ; 205 x 125 (130 x 60) mm. bound to 205 x 130 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from fol. 1a.|21 lines per page. Written in small naskh in black ink. Illuminated headpiece (ʻunwān) in gold, blue, red, black and white, with a basmalah on fol. 2b. The text is framed within a gilt border with black fillets. Catchword on the verso of each leaf. Verses of poetry in Arabic on fol. 1b. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals (fol. 1 is a fly-leaf with inscriptions).|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "al-Ḥikmah 21". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 855".|Several ownership statements with seals on fol. 1a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 175 leaves: paper ; 256 x 162 (178 x 90) mm. bound to 256 x 173 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from begining of text (fol. 2a, l. 14)|21 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh and nastaʻlīq with use of red. Two types of glazed paper: light cream paper with pulp visible and European paper with watermark. Several ḥāshiyah mostly by the same hand between the lines and on the margins. Several inscriptions on fol. 1a (some in Ottoman Turkish). Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "ʻAqāʼid 126". Inscription in Arabic numerals on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "1603".|Seal with the inscription "ʻAbd al-Ḥalīm" on the margin of the colophon (fol. 175b). Waqf: see seal on fol. 2a, with the inscription: "Waqf Kitābkhānah al-Ḥājj Muḥammad, 1253 [1837 or 8] (repeated on fol. 40a, 63a, 85a, 107a, 139a, 174b). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: vi, 196 leaves: paper ; 259 x 147 (163 x 80) mm. bound to 260 x 157 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from rubric on fol. (i)a.|22 lines per page. Written in medium small nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red. Light cream paper with laid and chain lines visible. Some leaves are damaged (see fol. 29; fol. 50-57 water damaged with text illegible). Title and note on the author on fol. 1a.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Tawḥīd 39". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 1281".|Copied on a Friday of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, no date (colophon, fol. 195a).|Ownership statements on fol. (i)a, (ii)a and 1a, in the name of Aḥmad Najīb, dated 1289 H. [1872 or 3], Qāsim ibn Sulaymān, and Yūsuf ibn Muḥammad al-Anṭālī. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Bayḍāwī, ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUmar, -1286? Ṭawāliʻ al-anwār min maṭāliʻ al-anẓār|Islam--Doctrines--14th century|Islamic philosophy--Early works to 1800|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
author_as_recorded: Iṣfahānī, Maḥmūd ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, 1275 or 1276-1348 or 1349
physical_description: Extent: 236 leaves: paper ; 180 x 131 (111 x 75) mm. bound to 181 x 145 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from fol. 1a (written by a later hand).|19 lines per page. Written in small naskh in black ink with use of red. The text is framed within two red fillets on fol. 2b and a single red fillet on fol. 3a. Light cream paper with laid and chain lines visible. Fol. 1 is a later fly-leaf with inscriptions on European glazed paper with watermark. Notes and short excerpts on the margins : some notes are attributed to al-ʻIbrī (see fol. 108a) ; excerpts from Sharḥ al-Mawāqit [by al-Jurjānī]. Several inscriptions on fol. 236b. Kabīkaj, magic script and magic square on fol. 2a. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "ʻAqāʼid thānī 139". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 1072".|Several ownership statements on fol. 2a, including one in the name of Tāj al-Dīn Afandī ; one in the name of Dhū al-Fiqār Afandī ; one dated 1090 H. [1679 or 80], with seal. Obliterated seals throughout (see fol. 3a). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Bayḍāwī, ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUmar, -1286? Ṭawāliʻ al-anwār min maṭāliʻ al-anẓār|Islam--Doctrines--History--14th century--Sources|Islamic philosophy--Early works to 1800|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
author_as_recorded: Iṣfahānī, Maḥmūd ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, 1275 or 1276-1348 or 1349
physical_description: Extent: 185 leaves: paper ; 182 x 132 (128 x 82) mm. bound to 182 x 140 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from fol. 1a (later hand).|19 lines per page. Written in thick nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red. Light cream paper with laid and chain lines visible. Some leaves are colored in red, in blue and in green. Fol. 121 falls in pieces. Fol. 1a is a later fly-leaf on European glazed paper with inscriptions. The last fly-leaf is pasted on fol. 185. Marginal annotations, mostly written by the same hand as the main text, with notes attributed to al-ʻIbrī, al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī (from his Sharḥ al-Mawāqif), etc. Catchword on the verso of each leaf. Table of contents on the pastedown of the upper cover. Inscription on the lower edge of the text block: "Iṣfahānī".|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "ʻAqāʼid 106". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 1099".|Copied by Mūsá ibn ṬṚMSh on 1 Rabīʻ al-Ākhar 864 (colophon, fol. 185a).|From the books of Aḥmad Najīb [19th cent.] (see ownership statement on fol. 1a). Ownership statement in the name of Ḥāfiẓ Muṣṭafá ʻAfatī on fol. 2a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: iii, 202, i leaves: paper ; 239 x 162 (178 x 115) mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1a).|25 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink (fading to brown) with use of red. Dark cream paper with laid lines visible. Collation notes on the margins. Fol. A-C are later additions in European glazed paper. Catchword on the verso of most leaves. Foliation in red ink using Arabic numerals. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals. Table of contents dated 8 R[ajab or Rabīʻ] 1250 [1834] on fol. Ba-b. Inscription in Arabic script in red pencil on fol. Aa: "Raqm 52".|Copy completed on 9 Ramaḍān 751 in Shīrāz by al-Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-[...] al-Iṣfahānī (colophon, fol. 202b).|Several ownership statements and seals on fol. 1a (mostly obliterated; one refering to Maḥmūd al-Ālūsī, dated 17 M[uḥarram] 1260 [1844]). Reading statement signed Muḥammad Ḥusayn ibn al-Shaykh Jaʻfar al-Najafī on fol. Ab (inverted). Ownership statement signed Muḥammad Ḥāmid son (najl) of sayyid Maḥmūd Afandī, muftī in Baghdād, al-Ālūsī [i.e. Muḥammad Hāmid al-Ālūsī, 1262-1290/1846-1873 or 4, and Maḥmūd Shihāb al-Dīn al-Ālūsī, 1217-1270/1802-1854, see EI² under Ālūsī]. Stamp in violet ink reading "Min kutub ʻAlī ibn al-Riḍā ibn Mūsá ibn Jaʻfar Kāshif al-Ghiṭāʼ" and dated 1334 [1915 or 16] on fol. Ca and 202b [The same stamp appears in Islamic Manuscripts, Garrett no. 308Y]. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

note: ff. 109. 195 x 105; 120 x 45 mm. 19 lin. 16th/17th cen.|Anonymous supergloss on al-Dawwānīʼs gloss and the gloss of al-Jurjānī. note: Fols. 44; 17.5 x 12.5 cm.; written surface 11 x 8 cm.; 9 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; entries in red.|A commentary on a section of Hidāyat al-ḥikmah which treats of al-Ṭabīʻīyāt (physics) and al-Ilāhīyāt (metaphysics).|Beg.: بسم الله ... القول في الطبىعىات وهو مرتب على ثلثة|Ending: ومن اراد الاستقصاء في الحکمة والوقوف على مذهب الحکماء فلىرجع الى کتابنا المسمى بزبدة الاسرار والله ولي التوفىق وبىده ازمّة التحقىق.|Marginal and interlinear notes and glosses. subject_as_recorded: Ibn al-ʻArabī, 1165-1240. Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam|Islamic philosophy--Early works to 1800|Sufism--Doctrines--Early works to 1800|Metaphysics--Early works to 1800|God (Islam)--Wisdom--Early works to 1800|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
physical_description: Extent: i, 143, i leaves : paper ; 245 x 177 (190 x 110) mm. bound to 247 x 182 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from fol. 2a.|Copied by Ibrāhīm bin Fayḍ Allāh bin Ismāʻīl al-Qrīmī(?) on the 23rd of "Jumādá al-Ākhirah/Rajab"(?) 1258 (1842) -- colophon (fol. 141b).|27 lines per page. Written in small nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red. Text written within a single line frame outlined in red ink. Fol. 2 is two leaves pasted together, the first of which has a table of contents on the verso which is now not visible and was re-written, in black ink with use of red for page numbers, on the verso of fol. 1. Foliation in red ink in Arabic numerals and in pencil in Western numerals start with 1 on fol. 3. Catchwords on the verso of each leaf. Glazed European paper. Circular ownership seal on fol. 2a in the name of al-Shaykh Muḥammad Kamāl al-Dīn al-Ḥarīrī al-Khalwatī, dated 1288 (1871-72).|Originally acquired by Robert Garrett from Abraham Shalom Yahuda ; 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Ibn al-ʻArabī, 1165-1240. Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam|Islamic philosophy--Early works to 1800|Sufism--Doctrines--Early works to 1800|Metaphysics--Early works to 1800|God (Islam)--Wisdom--Early works to 1800|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
physical_description: Extent: ii, 253 , ii leaves : paper ; 193 x 123 (130 x 60) mm. bound to 199 x 126 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from fol. 1a.|Copied by Najm al-Dīn ibn Shaykh Muḥammad al-Yāyinawī in 1065 (1654 or 55) -- colophon (fol. 247a).|17 lines per page. Written in small nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red. Foliation in red ink in Arabic numerals and in pencil in Western numerals. Catchwords on the verso of each leaf. Few marginal annotations. Glazed European paper. Ff. 1-23 are replacement sheets on a different, dark cream paper, written in a very similar hand and style as the original. Ff. 248b-249a contain Avicenna's Ijābat al-duʻāʼ wa-kayfīyat al-ziyārah (entitled in the ms.: "Risālah fī nafʻ al-ziyārah wa-al-ṣadaqah wa-al-duʻāʼ") in a later hand.|Originally acquired by Robert Garrett from Abraham Shalom Yahuda ; 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Islamic philosophy--Early works to 1800|Sufism--Doctrines--Early works to 1800|Metaphysics--Early works to 1800|Ontology--Early works to 1800|Creation (Islam)--Early works to 1800|God (Islam)--Early works to 1800|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
physical_description: Extent: 210 leaves : paper ; 220 x 153 (153 x 65) mm. bound to 220 x 160 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from fol. 3a.|Layout of text varies, but mostly 21 lines per page, written surface 150 x 65 mm (a few of the treatises are written across the whole page). Written in a casual small nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red. Foliation in black ink in Arabic numerals starts on fol. 5. Foliation in pencil in Western numerals. Catchwords present throughout. Glazed European paper. Ff. 3a-4b are table of contents written in black ink with use of red, in same hand as the main text. Fol. 1a has a Sūfī silsilah, mentioning the Khalwatīyah order, most probably by the compiler himself, as the style and handwriting is very similar to that in the main text.|Originally acquired by Robert Garrett from Abraham Shalom Yahuda ; 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 189 leaves: paper ; 182 x 136 (121 x 80) mm. bound to 190 x 140 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from note on the margin of fol. 1a.|28 lines per page. Written in small nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red. Dark cream paper with laid and chain lines visible. Marginal annotations on the part on Physics (particularly fol. 55b-102b). Inscription on fol. 189b. Inscription in red pencil on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Raqm S 18". Title on the lower edge of the text block.|Collation: Paper, fol. 189 ; fol. 1-6 + 1-238 ; catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Owned by Ālūsīʹzādah al-Sayyid Maḥmūd, muftī in Baghdād [Maḥmūd ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Ālūsī], who acquired this copy on 17 Muḥarram 1260 [Feb. 7, 1844]; acquired by ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ, with seal dated [12?]74 (ownership statements with seals, fol. 1a). Seal on fol. 189b. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Islamic philosophy--Early works to 1800|Sufism--Doctrines--Early works to 1800|Metaphysics--Early works to 1800|God (Islam)--Wisdom--Early works to 1800|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
physical_description: Extent: 99, i leaves : paper ; 185 x 137 (125 x 90) mm. bound to 185 x 145 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title supplied by the cataloger.|15 lines per page. Main text written in small naskh in black ink with use of red. The text of the glossary written in small nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red. Although the style of writing differs, the two texts seem to be contemporary and written continuously in same ink and possibly same hand. Catchwords on the verso of each leaf. Foliation in Western numerals in pencil.|Ms. additions: Numerous short inscriptions on fol. 1a, one of them dated 1163 (1750). Three short inscriptions and one ownership seal on fol. 99b. Ff. 16a-17a contain a text with the heading 'Faṣṣ ḥikmah fardīyah fī kalimah Muḥammadīyah' commenting on the final chapter of Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam. Ff. 97-98 contain a short commentary relating to Ibn al-ʻArabī's Mawāqiʻ al-nujūm. Extensive marginal annotations to the main text in a later hand.|Originally acquired by Robert Garrett from Abraham Shalom Yahuda ; 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Ibn al-ʻArabī, 1165-1240. Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam|Islamic philosophy--Early works to 1800|Sufism--Doctrines--Early works to 1800|Metaphysics--Early works to 1800|God (Islam)--Wisdom--Early works to 1800|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
physical_description: Extent: 293 leaves : paper ; 256 x 180 (173 x 118) mm. bound to 260 x 186 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title (in Ottoman) from fol. 1b.|The copying was completed on the 7th of Ramaḍān 893 (1488) -- colophon (fol. 292a). Collation note on the margin of the same fol. partially missing due to paper damage: collation completed on the 3rd of Jumādá al-Ūlá [...]89, probably 989 (1581) by ... Muḥammad Shafīʻ.|21 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red for rubrication. Text within a frame outlined in black ink filled with gold leaf and blue ink around it. Illuminated ʻunwān on fol. 1b made with gold leaf and blue, orange and yellow watercolors. Catchwords on the verso of each leaf. Some collation annotations in the margins throughout. Foliation in Western numerals in pencil. Few short inscriptions, several ownership statements dated variously 935, 1144, 1186, and 1226, and two obliterated seals on fol. 1a.|Originally acquired by Robert Garrett from Abraham Shalom Yahuda ; 1942.

physical_description: Extent: i, 262 leaves : paper ; 214 x 158 (160 x 100) mm. bound to 215 x 160 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from fol. 1a.|25 lines per page. Written in small nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red. Catchwords on the verso of each leaf. Foliation in Western numerals in pencil. Glazed European paper. Fol. 261b contains a paragraph, in the same hand as the main text, in the praise of Ibn al-ʻArabī, written by Aḥmad bin Sulaymān bin Kamāl (the copyist?). Title on fol. 1a is signed in different hand: ("katabahu") ʻAbd al-Raḥmān in the month of Rabīʻ al-Ākhir 1089 (1678). Two short inscriptions in Ottoman on fol. 1a. Two ownership statements on the same fol., one in the name of Aḥmad "al-mudarris li-madrasat Ibrāhīm", and the other in the name of Luṭf Allāh bin Yaʻqūb.|Originally acquired by Robert Garrett from Abraham Shalom Yahuda ; 1942.

author_as_recorded: Āmidī, ʻAlī ibn Abī ʻAlī, 1156 or 1157-1233
physical_description: Extent: iii, 240, iii leaves: paper ; 210 x 140 (170 x 100) mm. bound to 220 x 150 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1a).|Physical description: 23 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink (faded to brown). The last letters of some words at the end of a line are written on the margin, after a blank space. Cream paper, hardly translucid, with thin laid lines visible ; ruled. Fol. 153-154 inverted. Impression of a circular stamp (200 mm. ; apparently same faded ink) on fol.1b. Title on tail of text-block (inverted). Worm-eaten ; fragile.|Collation: Paper, fol. 241 ; 110 (-1 before fol. 1) 2-2410 252.|Waqf statement on fol. 1a, dated 25 or 15 ...(?) -97 H.(?), for the Khizānah of the Madrasah he built in Cairo ("madrasatihi allatī anshāhā bi-kh[end of line] al-muwāzinīn bi-al-shāriʻ al-aʻẓam bi-al-Qāhirah al-maḥrūsah") by al-Muqirr al-Ashraf al-ʻālī al-Jamālī Maḥmūd ustādār al-ʻālīyah al-malikī al-ẓāhir[ī] [end of line]"), [most probably Jamāl al-Dīn Maḥmūd al-Ustādār, d. 799/1396 or 7 ; if this is the case the date should read 797/1394 or 5]. Mention "waqf", some with a name, on the margins of several pages (see fol. 1a, 17b-18a).|Origin: The copy is not dated, but marginal annotations throughout mention that this copy was read in front of the author (d. 631/1233). See the mention "balaghtu al-qirāʻah ʻalá al-muṣannif" on the margin of fol. 195b, 198a, etc.|Rare Book Treatment Report enclosed with the ms. Collections Conservation Unit: 7/25/94.|Waqf probably from Jamāl al-Dīn Maḥmūd al-Ustādār, d. 799/1396 or 7. According to Ibn Ḥajar al-ʻAsqalānī (d. 1449), Maḥmūd al-Ustādār endowed to the madrasah he built in Cairo the books of Ibn al-Jamāʻah he bought after his death (al-Durar al-kāminah, ed. Cairo, 1349 H., vol. 2, p. 329). Acquired from Murād Bey al-Bārūdī, Beirut, 1925.

physical_description: Extent: 116 leaves : paper ; 301 x 225 (235 x 165) mm bound to 295 x 220 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 4a).|Marginal notes in red and black. Two short poems by al-Shaykh al-Qīrāṭī, a poem addressed to a certain al-Ahdal, two poems by Aḥmad al-Khallī eulogizing the Prophet, nine verses in praise of the family of Muḥammad and an ode by Abū Qāsim al-Nāshirī before the title page (f. 1a-3b). Following the colophon are several odes: one by Imruʼ al-Qays ibn Ḥujr al-Kindī, one by Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Daʻdaʻ al-Saʻdī in praise of Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Wāsiʻ al-Qurashī with a tārīkh for 1208 [1793], another ode eulogizing the same by Muḥsin ibn Muḥammad al-Hannād, a eulogy of the Prophet by ʻAbd al-Qādir, governor of Kawkabān, and an ode dated 1210 [1795] (f. 113a-116b).|Collation: Paper; fol. 116 ; catchwords ; modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|Layout: 9-22 lines per page.|Description: Verse separators and overlining in red ; watermarks (three crescents; roman-alphabet initials "FC" and "BA[?]"; other unidentified) ; MS in good condition.|Origin: According to colophon copy completed Sunday 20 [Dhū] al-Qaʻdah 1207 by ʻAbd Allāh ibn Ṣāliḥ ibn ʻAl[ī] al-Ḥawshī (fol. 112b).|Ownership signature dated 1242 (fol. 4a). Acquired from Brill, Leyden, 1900.

note: Copied A.H. 1013 [A.D. 1605] by ḥusayn ibn Aḥmad ibn ḥusayn al-Jazarī.|Fols. 200; 20.5 x 14 cm.; written surface 17.5 x 7.2 cm.; 31 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in naskhi; with vowel signs; with catchwords.|A collection of poems mostly of philosophical import, arranged in alphabetical order.|Beg.: بسم الله الرحمن الرحىم. الحمد لله رب العالمىن ... قال ابوالعلاء ... المعري رهن المحبسىن ... اني انشأت ابنىة اوزان توخىت فىها صدق الکلمة ونزهتها عن الکذب|Colophon: وکان الفراغ منه ىوم الجمعة المبارك في اواخر شهر شعبان من شهور سنة ثلث عشر بعد الالف على ىد افقر الورى الى رحمة الله تعالى حسىن بن احمد بن حسىن الجزري غفرالله له ولوالدىه ولجمىع المسلمىن وصلى الله على سىدنا محمد وعلى آله وصحبه اجمعىن والحمد لله وحده. م|Marginal notes; MS in good condition; Arabic leather binding with flap; gilt stamped on cover and flap.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.|ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), V, p. 309; Fihrist al-kutub al-ʻArabīyah al-maḥfūẓah bi-al-Kutubkhānah al-Khudaywīyah, IV, p. 298; Rieu, Supplement of the catalogue of the Arabic Mss, 1050.|Edited and translated by Kremer, ZDMG, vol. XXIX (1875), pp. 304-12; XXX (1876), pp. 40-52; XXXI (1877), pp. 471-83. See also Goldziher ib., vol. XXIX (1875), p. 637.

subject_as_recorded: Muḥammad, Prophet, -632--Poetry--Early works to 1800
author_as_recorded: Būṣīrī, Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd, 1213?-1296?
note: Fols. 29; 25.2 x 16.6 cm.; written surface 20.5 x 12 cm.; 6 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with full vowel signs; with illuminations.|A few interlinear notes; ruled marginal lines in red and color throughout. On the top and bottom of the title page are two panels with florate designs in gold on a blue background and bearing the text in white ink. The space between these panels is filled with an octagonal medallion bearing the dedicatory inscription supplemented by a design similar to that mentioned above. Each of the following pages is decorated with six rosettes in blue and gold. At the bottom of the last folio, recto, is a panel showing a florate design in gold on green and blue on a ruddier gold. The signature of the copyist, Surūr Murjān, appears in white ink on an octagonal lozenge occupying the central portion of the panel. This copy was made for the library of the Mamlūk Sultan Ṭūmān Bāy, A.H. 922 [A.D. 1517]. MS in good condition; Arabic binding with flap.|Acquired from Aṣfar and Sarkīs, Damascus, A.D. 1929.

On the three following folios are five short poems by five different authors.|2. An ode in praise of the Prophet by al-Shihāb al-Khafājī modelled after al-Burdah of Kaʻb ibn Zuhayr ibn Abī Sulmá.|3. al-Burdah of al-Būṣīrī (, A.D. 1294).|4. The dīwān of ʻAfīf al-Dīn al-Tilimsānī, A.H. 690 [A.D. 1291]. See ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), III, p. 297.|5. A collection of anthology by various authors.|MS in good condition; Arabic binding with flap. Probably from the XIXth century.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

note: Copied in Makkah, A.H. 863 [A.D. 1459] by Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Murshidī al-Shīrāzī.|Fols. 41; 25.5 x 17 cm.; written surface 18.5 x 13.5 cm.; 12 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi and thuluth; with vowel signs; with catchwords; with illuminations.|A collection containing:|1. A pentastichous amplification (takhmīs) by Nāṣir al-Dīn Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad al-MāIikī al-Fayyūmī of Qaṣīdat al-Burdah, the famous ode in praise of the Prophet by al-Būṣīrī, A.H. 694 [A.D. 1294/5]. See Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 7814¹.|2. A pentastichous amplification of Qaṣīdat Bānat Suʻād, the famous ode in praise of the Prophet by Kaʻb ibn Zuhayr.|3. [ʻUnwān al-ḥikam], a wisdom ode by Abū al-Fatḥ al-Bustī, A.H. 401 [A.D. 1010/1]. See Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), IV, pp. 533/4; Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 7591.|MS illuminated in gold and color; medallions in gold and color in margins. MS in fair condition; Arabic cloth binding with flap.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

subject_as_recorded: Medicine, Arab|Arabic poetry--Early works to 1800
note: Fols. 120; 16 x 10.5 cm.; written surface 11-12 x 7 cm.; 12-20 lines to page; on European paper; in naskhi; with catchwords; entries in red.|A collection containing:|1. Kitāb al-Raḥmah fī al-ṭibb wa-al-ḥikmah, by Mahdī ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣubunrī, a work on medicine dealing with: (a) the science of medicine; (b) dietetics and medicines; (c) preventive medicine; (d) treatment of specific diseases; (e) treatment of common ills. Copy was made in A.H. 1244 [A.D. 1828].|2. A collection of poems beginning with a qaṣīdah by the Shīʻte Ibn Abī al-ḥadīd, A.H. 655 [A.D. 1257]; see Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 7757(1). Among the rest are the seven muʻallaqāt. Copy was made in A.H. 1245 [A.D. 1829].|Marginal notes; MS in very poor condition; badly stained with dampness; Arabic leather binding; blind stamped.|Acquired from Brill, Leyden, A.D. 1904.

Red circle marks at the beginning and end of each verse; in groups of three for hemistich. European laid paper. Fol. 41-56b: Blank. On upper cover: Ḥadīth and reading statement ("naẓara fīh"), the latter hardly legible. Magical inscriptions, table with inscriptions in Ottoman Turkish, mentioning "Raml Dānyāl", and ownership statements on fol. 1a-2a. Twelve lines of poetry in bāʾ on fol. 2b. Verses of poetry and several inscriptions, one mentioning the date 1267 H., on fol. 40b and 57a-58b.|Chiefly quinions; catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "SH Ḥimṣ(?) 188" (repeated on the pastedown). Inscription in Roman script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "117Y".|Origin: According to colophon, copied by al-Sayyid Ḥasan al-Ḥamawī, "28 khalat" Shawwāl 1131 [Sept. 1719] (fol. 40a).|Ownership statement in the name of al-Sayyid ʻAlī ibn al-marḥūm al-Sayyid Asʻad ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Jawwād al-Ḥawrā [ʻAlī ibn Asʻad ibn ʻAbd al-Jawwād] on fol. 1a (repeated on fol. 58b, with name reading: "al-Sayyid ʻAlī ibn al-marḥūm al-Sayyid Asʻad ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Jawwād al-shahīr bi-Ibn al-Ḥawrá (or: Ḥawrī)", dated Aleppo, Ramaḍān 1184 [1771]). Reading statement and shahādah in the name of Yāsīn ibn ʻUmar al-Mīkāʾīlī, dated Shaʻbān 1176 [1763-1764], on fol. 1b. Reading statement in the name of al-Sayyid Ḥasan ibn al-marḥūm al-Sayyid Asʻad ibn al-marḥūm al-shaykh ʻAbd al-Jawwād al-Ḥawrá (or: al-Ḥawrī) on fol. 58b. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: i, 150, i leaves : paper ; 175 x 130 (120 x 95) mm. bound to 175 x 135 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from illuminated title apge (fol. 3a).|Physical description: 15 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Thick dark cream paper, hardly translucid, with pulp visible and laid paper. Gold ruled frame outlined in green with flecks at corners on fol. 3b-4a. Several inscriptions on fol. 1a-2b, including verses of poetry and two reading statements. Title on tail of text block (hardly legible). Lacuna between fol. 83 and 84 ; a few holes and stains.|Chiefly quinions. Catchword on the verso of each leaf ; the quires are numbered using Arabic ordinals (see "Thānī" on fol. 13a).|Decoration: Illuminated title page on fol. 3a, executed in gold, green red, and blue. One panel outlined in green with radiating flecks. The panel is divided in two uneven parts. The upper part is a rectangular panel with a cartouche bearing the title. The lower part occupies three fourth of the panel and consists of a four lobed figure with the rest of the title. The inner corners have a flower in gold on a green ground.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Adabīyāt 54". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥ 186".|Origin: According to colophon, copied by ʻAlī ibn Ḥusayn ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-HWLshī al-Kutubī (fol. 149a).|Reading statements on fol. 1a-3a, one in the name of Ḥasan ibn al-shaykh ʻAlī al-Bujaʻ [Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī al-Bujaʻ] (fol. 1a and 2b, the latter dated 1092 H., with seal) ; one in the name of ʻAlāʾ al-Dīn ʻAlī Ibn Abī al-Fatḥ Ibn Muẓaffar al-Makkī al-...? al-Shāfiʻī, Qusṭanṭinīyah, with date (fol. 3a). Ownrship statement in the name of ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz al-Adalī, "imām fī ṣanʻat al-shiʻr". on fol. 3a. Inscription dated 1156 H. on fol. 2b. Owership statements and reading statetements on fol. 149a, one stating that the volume was bought from Aḥmad al-Ẓabbākh Ibn al-Adaqī al-Farʻī. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: i, 103, i leaves : paper ; 210 x 135 (165 x 100) mm. bound to 215 x 145 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title provided by cataloger.|Physical description: 12 lines per page. Written in medium large nastaʻlīq in black ink, with use of red for headings and miniatures' caption. The text is framed in gold, red, and black, with an outer frame consisting of a single black line. Two columns separated by double lines in black ink. Some miniatures are protected by a smaller piece of paper pasted on the inner margin, with inscriptions. Inscription in Roman script on fol. 1a, reading: "Adjudan [or: Adjudah?] Sing Sepay / Company".|Decoration: Illuminated headpiece with basmalah, executed in gold and colors (fol. 3b). Contains sixteen miniatures.|Miniature 1 (fol. 12b): King, attendants and visitors.|Miniature 2 (fol. 17a): The birth of Prince Bī Naẓīr ("Tavallud-i Shāhzādah Bī Naẓīr").|Miniature 3 (fol. 21a): Prince and five female characters in a garden, with parrots in cages.|Miniature 4 (fol. 23b): Shāhzādah at the ḥammām ("Dar āmadan Shāhzādah dar ḥammām"), with four attendants, one holding a mirror where one sees a reflection of the main character.|Miniature 5 (fol. 29a): Shāhzādah taken in the air by Parī's.|Miniature 6 (fol. 33b): Shāhzādah wakes up in the land of the Parī's ("Bīdār shudan-i Shāhzādah dar Parīstān").|Miniature 7 (fol. 36a): Presentation of a winged horse by a Parī to Shāhzādah; the painting also shows two female attendants and a dīv.|Miniature 8 (fol. 41b): Bī Naẓīr dismounts his winged horse, and meets Badr-i Munīr.|Miniature 9 (fol. 47a): Bī Naẓīr and Badr-i Munīr drink together ("Sharābkashī bā hamdigar"); the painting also shows two female attendants and the winged horse.|Miniature 10 (fol. 53a): Bī Naẓīr and Badr-i Munīr "unite" ("wiṣāl bā yakdigar"), with two female attendants.|Miniature 11 (fol. 56b): Bī Naẓīr is put in the well by dīv's ("Dar chāh andakhtan-i Bī Naẓīr"); the painting shows three dīv's, a parī and a female attendant.|Miniature 12 (fol. 69b): The despair of Badr-i Munīr; the painting shows Badr-i Munīr and four other female characters.|Miniature 13 (fol. 72b): Fīrūz Shāh hears about the story; the painting shows a winged prince on a throne carried by two winged Parī's and a female character; animals including a snake, a tiger, and a bear, are sitting in the fore-gound.|Miniature 14 (fol. 80b): Bī Naẓīr is taken out of the well ("Birūn kashīdan-i Bī Naẓīr az chāh"); the painting shows Bī Naẓīr on the shoulders of a dīv; two other dīv's, the winged prince and a female character are also present.|Miniature 15 (fol. 93a): The wedding of Bī Naẓīr and Badr-i Munīr ("Nikāḥ-i Bī Naẓīr bā Badr-i Munīr"). The painting shows Bī Naẓīr sitting in front of two men; in the foreground are Badr-i Munīr and two men sitting.|Miniature 16 (fol. 98a): Bī Naẓīr meets the parents ("mulāqāt-i Bī Naẓīr bā padar u mādar").|Origin: The copy is not dated.|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

note: Ms. codex.|Title from fol. 2a.|13 lines per page. Written in small nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red. About half of the text (up to and including fol. 83) is written in two columns inside a single line frame in red ink, and the rest of the text is without the frame. Ff. 13b-14a have a double line frame in red ink. Catchwords on the verso of each leaf. Ms. additions: several short inscriptions on fol. 2a and 13a; additional lines of poetry in different hands follow the main text on fol. 201a-202b. Dark cream paper with visible laid lines and prominent fibres. Fol. i-1 and 203-iii (i.e. the free endleaves) are a later addition in modern square ruled paper.

physical_description: Extent: 212 leaves : paper, ill. ; 213 x 116 mm. bound to 214 x 122 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Physical description: Written in a variety of scripts, mostly ruqʻah and naskh, in black on glazed, laid European paper, some tinted yellow. Safīnah-style. Headings rubricated. Fol. 1a-3a laid out in red grid lines; fol. 3b-26b framed with two columns in red, but text runs through column lines. Some illustrations and diagrams. Inserts between fol. 56-57, 80-81, 95-96, 139-140, 141-142, 209-210. Fol. 172 partially torn away. Paginated as follows in Arabic script beginning on fol. 4a: 1-47, 47, (p. skipped), 48-52, (skipped), 60, 63-80, 85-116, (2 skipped), 118, (skipped), 119-167, 167-191, 191-308, 313-359, (2 skipped), 360-425. Some damp staining, mostly marginal. A few paper repairs. In fair condition.|Origin: Two texts are dated 1234 H. [1818 or 19] (fol. 21b) and 1223 H. [1808 or 9] (157a).

On the folio following the last page is a quotation from the Murūj al-dhahab of al-Masʻūdī, A.H. 345 [A.D. 956]. On the twenty following folios are: (1) The famous poem in praise of the Prophet by al-Būṣīrī A.H. 608-694 [A.D. 1212-1294/5] entitled al-Kawākib al-durrīyah fī madḥ Khayr al-Barīyah and generally known as the Ode of the Burdah (see 61); (2) Selections from the dīwān of Ibn al-Fāriḍ A.H. 576-632 [A.D. 1181-1235], a collection of original poems on divine love and wine. MS in good condition but worm-eaten; Arabic leather binding with flap; color stamped and tooling on cover and flap.|Acquired by Ananikian, from Egypt, A.D. 1924.|Khulāṣat al-Athar III, p. 236; Fihrist al-kutub al-ʻArabīyah al-maḥfūẓah bi-al-Kutubkhānah al-Khudaywīyah, V, pp. 60/1; Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 9743; Rieu, Supplement of the catalogue of the Arabic Mss, 590.

note: ff. 177. 205 x 152; 165 x 111 mm. 191in. 15th cen.|Partial contents: fol. 1b--7b anonymous takhmīs of Bānat Suʻād which begins: دم المحب بسىف الهجر مطلول * ودمعه بعد بىن الحب مهمول|Then follow Takhmīs al-Burdah by ʻAlāʼ al-Dīn ʻAlī ibn Sālim al-Ghazzī (8a-25b), al-Qaṣīdah al-Shuqrāṭisīyah (29b-33a - in the ms. vocalized ʻʻShiqrāṭisīyah”) and another poem by al-Shuqrāṭisī rhyming in nā (incomplete at end - lacuna after fol. 33), a number of poems in praise of the Prophet (34a-82b), a muwashshaḥ by Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim al-Saʻdī (84a-85a), poems by Ibn Zuqqāʻah (92a-93a, 139a-142a), ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn Ghānim al-Maqdisī (129b-138b, 163b-165a), etc.

subject_as_recorded: Arabic poetry--Early works to 1800

physical_description: Extent: 62 leaves: paper ; 193 x 133 (165 x 95) mm. bound to 193 x 145 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1a).|Physical description: 14 lines per page. Written in medium large naskh in black ink with use of red. The text is framed within a single line in red ink (irregular). Thick dark cream to biscuit paper with large laid lines visible. note: Ms. codex.|Title from illuminated title page (fol. 3a).|Physical description: 15 lines per page. Written in medium small square naskh in black ink with use of red. Thick dark cream to biscuit paper, glossy, hardly translucid. Occasional marginal annotation. Verses of poetry by later hands on fol. 1a-2b and 92a-93a. Quinions; catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Decoration: Illuminated title page on fol. 3a executed in gold, red, blue, and black, and consisting of a panel with a roundel on the left margin, outlined in blue with radiatings flecks. The panel consists of two parts: an upper cartouche occupying one third of the surface bears the title ; the lower part consists of a square with a central roundel bearing the statement of responsibility and corner pieces. Illuminated colophon on fol. 91b, executed in the same colors, and consisting of a panel outlined in blue with radiating flecks at each corner, with a central roundel with two small roundel on the vertical axis and corner pieces.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "47".|Origin: According to colophon, copied by Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Bukhārī(?) al-Mālikī (fol. 90b). A note on the margin of fol. 91b indicates that the copy was completed in 88- H. R. Mach reads 880 H.|Several ownership statements and reading statements on fol. 91b, including one in the name of Ibrāhīm ibn al-sayyid ʻAlī al-... al-Shāfiʻī, dated 1092 H. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

title_as_recorded: Sharḥ al-Burdah al-muntakhab min Ṭīb al-ḥabīb lil-Khujandī
subject_as_recorded: Burdah (Būṣīrī, Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd)|Būṣīrī, Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd, 1213?-1296? Burdah|Muḥammad, Prophet, -632--Poetry--Early works to 1800|Muḥammad, Prophet, -632
author_as_recorded: Ibn Maḥmūd, Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh
note: ff. 117. 178 x 128; 123 x 90 mm. 15 lin. Shawwāl 883, Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Azharī nazīl Ḥalab.|According to fol. 116b this is an abridgment by Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Maḥmūd (identical with the copyist? cf. infra) of Ṭīb al-ḥabīb, a commentary on the Burdah by al-Khujandī (cf. Brockelmann, GAL, I, 309, commentary 9; Mashhad, adabīyāl no. 76; the ms. Leiden 718 contains an abridgment). The ms. Garrett 66 (fol. 2a) contains a biographical note by Khujandī's disciple Zayn al-Dīn al-Khawāfī (d. 838/1435: Brockelmann, GAL, II, 265) according to which Jalāl al-Dīn Abū Ṭāhir Aḥmad al-Khujandī d. 7 Dhū al-Qaʻdah 802/ 1400. Hkh col. 1336 mentions al-Khujandī's commentary without quoting its incipit, but in col. 1333 he identifies a text with incipit identical with that of the above-mentioned mss. (الحمد لله الذى خلع على حبىبه محمد) as being Ibn Marzūq al-Tilimsānī's Izhār ṣidq al-mawaddah, which is evidently incorrect; see Garrett no 39Yq. Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn,'s identification was adopted by Ahlwardt, Berlin 7788 (= Brockelmann, GAL, I, 309, commentary 7). Of the two identical mss. Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi Kütüphanesi Arapc̦a yazmalar kataloğu, 8542 and 8543 the former is ascribed to Ibn Marzūq, the latter to al-Khujandī.|Incip.: ... حامدا الله العلى العظىم ومستعىنا بالله العزىز العلىم|The commentary on first verse begins on fol. 1b, line 7: ... الذکر بالضم بالقلب وبالکسر باللسان وعند بعض کل فى کل

subject_as_recorded: Burdah (Būṣīrī, Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd)|Būṣīrī, Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd, 1213?-1296? Burdah|Muḥammad, Prophet, -632--Poetry--Early works to 1800|Muḥammad, Prophet, -632
author_as_recorded: Ibn Marzūq, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad, 1311?-1379 or 1380
note: ff. 262. 296 x 204; 207 x 120 mm. 29 lin. 16th/17th cen.|Commentary on the Burdah, completed in Tilimsān, 18 Muḥarram 810: Brockelmann, GAL, (first ed.) 265 (commentary 1); S I, 467; Fihris al-makhṭūṭāt al-ʻArabīyah al-maḥfūẓah fī al-Khizānah al-ʻĀmmah bi-al-Rabāṭ al-Fatḥ, 2nd ser., no. 811. Title in the preface, fol. 2a paen. The excerpt quoted in Leiden catalogue no. 714 begins on fol. 2a, line 11 of the present ms.|Incip.: ... الحمد لله الذى افضل نعم افضاله ... اما بعد فان من نعم الله علىنا|The commentary on v. 1 begins on fol. 2b: ... التذکر مصدر تذکر تفعل من الذکر وله معان وهو هنا ضد النسىان

subject_as_recorded: Burdah (Būṣīrī, Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd)|Būṣīrī, Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd, 1213?-1296? Burdah|Muḥammad, Prophet, -632--Poetry|Muḥammad, Prophet, -632
note: ff. 22. 220 x 137; 140 x 70 mm. 20 lin. 19th cen. On the margins a brief commentary and Turkish translation rhyming in -in.|Anon. commentary in verse on the Burdah in the form of an amplification of the poem. Each verse of the Burdah is followed by three verses of comment, the scope of which is indicated in the preface (fol. 1b antepaen.): بىتان لشرح بىت بانشراح وبىت * لبىان بدىع فىه فالتزم|The commentary on v. 1 runs as follows:|اوجه مزجك دمعا جار با بدم * شوق الحبىب ىذکر الصحب فى الحرم|او التحسر للارواح سالمة * فى عالم الغىب عن عىب وعن الم|فىه البراعة والاغراق ثم مزىّل * الجناس والانسجام فى الکلم
